pages.text: So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
The guilty shall be known by their marks; and they shall be seized by the forelocks and by the feet
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
This is Hell that the guilty deny
to and fro shall they pass, between it and boiling waters
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
And for one who fears standing before his Lord, there are two Gardens
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
Each abounding in green branches
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
In each are two fountains flowing
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
In each are two kinds of every fruit
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
They recline upon beds lined with rich brocade, the fruits of the two Gardens near at hand
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
Therein are maidens of modest gaze, whom neither man nor jinn has ever touched
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
Even as the ruby and as the coral stone are they
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
Is the reward of goodness aught but goodness? a So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
And beyond these two are two Gardens—
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny?—
of deepest green
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
In each are two fountains bubbling
So which of your Lord’s boons do you two deny
